isa_json.title: A large-scale multicenter breast cancer DCE-MRI benchmark dataset with expert segmentations
isa_json.description: The MAMA-MIA dataset consolidates and harmonizes 1,506 pre-treatment T1-weighted DCE-MRI cases from four TCIA collections (ISPY1, ISPY2, NACT, DUKE). It provides expert-corrected tumor segmentations, harmonized clinical and demographic variables, and baseline AI model weights to support breast cancer AI research.

identified_tools.name: nnU-Net
identified_tools.description: Deep learning framework used for generating preliminary segmentations and training the baseline segmentation model.

identified_tools.name: Mango viewer
identified_tools.description: Software tool used by 16 experts to manually correct and verify the preliminary automatic segmentations.

identified_tools.name: nibabel
identified_tools.description: Python library used for image processing and orientation standardization (reorienting to LAS/PSR systems).

identified_tools.name: SimpleITK
identified_tools.description: Library used for image analysis and processing.

identified_tools.name: pycad
identified_tools.description: Python library used to transform original DICOM images from TCIA to NIfTI format.

identified_tools.name: seg-metrics
identified_tools.description: Python library used to compute validation metrics like Dice coefficient and Hausdorff Distance.

identified_tools.name: pandas
identified_tools.description: Library used for data filtering and visualization scripts provided in the repository.

identified_tools.name: matplotlib
identified_tools.description: Library used for plotting MRI images and visual inspection.

agent_thoughts:
The document describes the creation of the MAMA-MIA dataset. 

1.  **Investigation Extraction**: The title is clearly stated. The description is summarized from the abstract. The study is a Data Descriptor for a benchmark dataset.

2.  **Study Factors**: Identified from the 'Data Records' and 'Technical Validation' sections (e.g., Scanner Manufacturer, Magnetic Field Strength, Clinical outcomes).

3.  **ISA Hierarchy (Workflow)**:
    *   **Data Collection**: Sourced from TCIA (ISPY1, ISPY2, NACT, DUKE). Selection criteria (Fig 2) applied.
    *   **Harmonization**: Consolidating clinical data, standardizing image orientation (Fig 1).
    *   **Segmentation Workflow**: 
        *   Preliminary segmentation using nnU-Net (trained on auxiliary data).
        *   Visual QC by 2 radiologists.
        *   Expert correction by 16 experts using Mango viewer.
    *   **Baseline Model**: Training a new nnU-Net on the final expert annotations.

4.  **Tools & Models**: 
    *   Software: nnU-Net, Mango viewer, nibabel, SimpleITK, pandas, pycad.
    *   Models: nnU-Net (used for both preliminary and baseline).

5.  **Measurements**: DSC, Hausdorff Distance (validation), FTV, SER (volumetric analysis).

6.  **Metadata**: Extracted case counts (1506), license (CC-BY-NC), and repository location.
